text: my role is a professor at the university
of michigan in the college of
engineering and there i teach classes in
climate science as part of that i've
also been making technologies over the
years of my 40th year teaching at the
university and some of the technology
was about how how do i help my students
learn better during class we started up
in AWS to take this whole technology
that echo360 had which is about
capturing what happens during class what
we've done is yes you can easily use
transcribe to take the lecture and
convert it into a transcription the
second part what we're doing is is to
take not only the audio and video from
the classroom but on top of that we have
access
unlike most to the students notes we
have access to the students questions
they can pose questions during class
they have access to the instructor
slides
we can rip the words off the slides and
store those and so taking all that
information we're using artificial
intelligence then to figure out what was
class about so it's this capacity to do
the transcription gives us the power to
contextually find material in the videos
and that that I think is game-changing
